Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: nannyp7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from ocean city. We stayed at the Atlantic Hotel again. The hotel was once again clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. We have stayed there for years and will continue to do so. You can't beat the price and the location is great. We recommend the hotel to our friends. The hotel isn't fancy but we are always comfortable. We recommend you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Boardwalk View”
Reviews.Author: waltso
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Atlantic. Hotel feels more like a Bread & Breakfast. Friendly staff and a big thank you to Denise and Teneka for making our stay very enjoyable. Location and view from the deck make this hotel a great choice. Keep up the good work and we'll see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean”
Reviews.Author: marauder40
Reviews.Content: In my opinion the hotel can easily be summed up by "Old but clean". This is the oldest hotel in Ocean City, but it has been updated. It doesn't have all the things many have come to expect in modern hotels (i.e. in-room safes, blow-dryers, electronic key-cards, irons and ironing boards already in the room) but it has all the basics of a hotel at the beach. Due to the age of the hotel and them having to remodel to add things like bathrooms in every room, every room has a different layout and amenities. Advantages - * Hotel is on the boardwalk, practically right across from Ripley's Believe It or Not. Can't get much closer to the end of the boardwalk. * Room was very clean. Excellent job both cleaning between guests and every day. Considering this is a hotel on the beach, that isn't an easy job. Can tell by the wear in the sheets, blankets, etc. that they are washed often. From what I hear they totally strip the beds between guests. * Low cost for in-season hotel rooms. * Love the balcony overlooking the boardwalk. * Large free parking lot right in the middle of downtown OC. Only one parking space per room, but still nice compared to others in the area. Disadvantages - * Lots of steps. Building is 4 floors. Rooms with only 2 digits in their number are on parking lot level. There are no rooms on lobby/boardwalk level (at least that I saw). 3 digit numbers starting with 1 and 2 are actually the 3rd and 4th level from parking lot respectively. They do have an elevator but due to its age it must be operated by hotel staff. They are more then willing to run it for you, but unless you are handicapped plan on only using it for bringing luggage to and from your room. * Would be nice if they wiped down the seagull droppings on the railing on the balcony overlooking the boardwalk at least once a day. * They claim beds are queen size, but smallest queen beds I have seen. Seemed to be full size. Looked for labels on bed and can't remember exact brand but it was either "Sealy" or "Serta". Label didn't list the size. * Hallway noise. The doors are old and noisy to open and close. Every room has two sets of doors since the doors pre-date air conditioning. So there can be lots of noise when large groups of people are going in and out of their room. We brought ear plugs, but it never got so noisy that we needed them. Other then that the only problems we had were that our room had no closet and only a shower so hanging wet things up was very difficult. Every room is different so some rooms have closets, some don't. Every room has its advantages and disadvantages. Some will feel that being on the top floor is a disadvantage due to steps, other will like it because of less noise. Some will like having rooms closer to the boardwalk, others will prefer farther away. One nitpick that we had is that there aren't enough no-smoking signs in the building so people realize they aren't supposed to be smoking in rooms/hallways. For the first part of our stay, the hallway in front of our room reeked of cigarette smoke. The room itself was fine and after whatever guest was doing it checked out, things were fine and the hotel itself isn't totally responsible for its guests but we only saw one no-smoking sign and it was in the stairwell, so we would understand if guests didn't realize you aren't supposed to smoke inside in Maryland hotels. All in all a great trip and a nice hotel. We will most likely stay here again unless the private rental condo we usually stay in opens up again for non-family rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane74
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in another hotel which was so bad that my husband and I were ready to pack up and go home. After we saw the Atlantic from the boardwalk we decided to see if they had any rooms available. We walked in and spoke with Teresa at the front desk. She was so warm and friendly and genuinely concerned about us. She offered us a room and even let us go upstairs and look at it ( because we were traumatized by previous hotel!!) before we paid for it. Let me say that I am in the hotel business and see all types of hotels in my days at work. From 2 star to 5 star. The Atlantic was by far the cleanest hotel I have seen! They have kept the charm but still have updated and made it very comfortable. Tammy in housekeeping made sure our room was ready quickly. We checked in at 11:30 after moving from the other hotel. She went above and beyond and even recommened a room for next years trip. In the 2 days we spent here everyone was friendly, which is really hard to find these days. We spent alot of time talking with another employee there name Mr. C. What a wonderful man! He talked with our son and spent some time talking about his own son, it is so refreshing to see happy people. My only regret is that we would of found this hotel years ago. What a wonderful place! Thanks for saving our vacation, see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Lynn139
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Atlantic for a very brief one night, two day trip to OC, MD. We arrived on a Monday and did not have lodging secured. After some help from the visitor's center we were directed to the Atlantic with the promise of a very favorable rate. The hotel proved to be great and a great value. Our room was clean and homey. Though the bathroom was small it was spotless as was the sink in the room. Though the beds seemed more like doubles than queens they were more than comfortable. The overall hotel atmosphere was cozy and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool, though small, was clean and warm! And the parking was convenient. You cannot beat the location of this hotel as it is near everything! I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Undecided”
Reviews.Author: D Z
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in one of their apartments in July of 2011. We traveled with 4 kids, 3 teenagers, and 4 adults. The apartment was spacious and very clean when we arrived and it fit us well. The kitchen was large as well as one bathroom. We also had a small bathroom with just the basics. The cupboards were well stocked with towels, toilet paper, washcloths, etc... and the kitchen was stocked with dishes, utensils, etc... We also had a large living room and dining room. The location was perfect for us, especially with younger children. The only complaints that I have was the front door lock did not lock well and when it did you had a difficult time getting it open. The other complaint I have was housekeeping. We cleaned our own place and never saw a housekeeper for the week we were there. We had to take our dirty towels to the front office to exchange them for clean ones and when I did that I was told they had 5. I then took the five towels back to the apartment to share for 11 people. No one ever came and changed our bed sheets the whole time we were there. If there was no housekeeping for the apartments, I wish we were told. Otherwise the lobby and hallways were clean. We also requested 2 roll-away beds for our apartment and they were not there when we arrived eventhough I booked this hotel in January. I would go back but I have a few questions before I would!

Reviews.Title: “Only choose out of desperation”
Reviews.Author: HMon14
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat, when looking for a hotel this hotel is not for guests used to hotels such as Hampton Inns, Marriotts, or any of your brand name hotels. That said this is a beach hotel and it reflects in its cleanliness. The green floor was two colors, green and black, but given the shapes of the black spots, I don't believe it was meant to be both colors. The bedding seemed to be between a white and off white color with an aged yellow mixed in. The toilet seemed to have stains on it from lid to seat, which is rather disgusting. At least the shower was clean which is always important. However, the shower's drain could not handle the sand or hair that ended up all over the tub after one shower. It's unpleasant to be showering with your hair and sand floating around the tub, and women with long hair know that it inevitable to not lose a strand or two while showering. After getting out of the shower you are expected to use such small towel. I just make 5 feet and the towels barely covered me from chest to bottom, which is uncomfortable if you're staying with a boyfriend or even your father. The bed was somewhat hard, but after a long day at the beach, it's hardly noticeable. However, the television would cut out while watching the Olympics and the wi-fi was extremely spotty as it is completely public. Perhaps the worst part of the stay was the fact that our room was not cleaned. We had asked the cleaning staff to come back in a few minutes because we were collecting our things and were still using the room. She had talked to both my boyfriend and myself. We both passed her sitting and talking with other staff members, which should have given the indication that we were out of our room. However, when we returned that evening the room had still not been cleaned and no one had brought the extra pillow I had requested. I called to ask for the pillow again and when I walked to the front desk I mentioned that the room had not been cleaned. The lady at the front desk said that it happens often and that they had gone for the day. When I explained that I had seen them sitting outside chatting, she merely said that she believed me and handed me towels. There was hardly and apology and nothing to compensate for the now sandy room. Needless to say, I showered with my flip flops on that night to avoid the sand that now lined the tub. I feel it's also important to stress how thin the walls are between the rooms. At any point in the day you can hear the rooms next to you and above you, which is uncomfortable and if you have rude neighbors as we did, you will be woken up early in the morning. If you are looking for a hotel based only on location this hotel is a great one. It is right on the boardwalk, but the beach never seems to get to crowded. It is also near the inlet and it's not a far walk either way to check out some of the sites of Ocean City. That said, in the future, I will always make sure to book earlier so that I will not have to book again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean City hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 2 years in a row. We love the hotel. Even though it is old, it is well maintained and always very clean. The internet connection was very good as well. The rooms don't offer some of the amentities that larger hotels do, but we are hardly in the room. We love sitting out on the patio/deck that overlooks the boardwalk. We bring bikes, and feel very comfortable leaving them connected to the bike rack there. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be on the ocean, but would like that to be reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vacation Spot Every Year”
Reviews.Author: Josh A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this hotel last year when looking for a vacation spot. We are from VA and were looking for a spot in Ocean City. I found the Atlantic Hotel through a Google search and checked them out. We called them to check prices and availability. They had some rooms available and the price was definitely right, so we booked it. All they require to reserve the room is a deposit of the first night's stay, though you can pay the entire amount ahead of time if you wish. Be aware that like most beach hotels, price varies depending on holidays and which part of the beach season it is. This hotel also is fully booked months in advance, so don't expect to call and get a room for next week. Staff is very nice, with the exception of your rotten tomato here and there, which you would expect anywhere. The rooms are very clean. My wife, two kids, and I got a double queen room with a fridge and microwave. When we went this year, we requested the same room we had last year, and they happily made that happen. Our room was on the second floor, ocean front, and they had upgraded the room we stayed in with a flat panel TV since we stayed last year. Some mention they don't have a complimentary breakfast, but one shouldn't expect this because of the price point. If you want to stay at a much higher priced hotel, I'm sure you'll get that "complimentary" breakfast. If you're looking for a great, family owned hotel, with a home town feeling, decent prices, and that's clean, this is place for you. My Only Call-outs 1. There isn't a general access elevator, so if you're on the second floor, prepare for a hike. It's 50 steps from the parking lot to the second floor. With it being four of us and staying for 5 days, we had a lot of stuff. The staff brought us out a cart which we loaded our stuff on, and took us up on the staff elevator, which was nice. 2. The bathroom is very small. You have to sit sideways on the toilet because of where the door is at. I spent the least amount of my time in the bathroom, so definitely not a deal breaker for me. 3. Ocean City is a late night city, so we did get a good bit of noise in the hallway late and night and early in the morning, but this isn't fault of the hotel, I would expect this anywhere. My kids are 4 and 5 and the hallway noise did not disturb them over the noise of the TV and the AC, so this wasn't too much of an issue for us. Conclusion We love this hotel and have made it our family vacation destination every year. We just got back home 2 days ago and are already planning our trip hear next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: adebb
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Small room but fabulous location. It's a very cozy comfortable and fun place to stay. Would definitely recommend. The only down side was housekeeping in room was not great. Stayed five days and they only vacumned once. Had to ask for more soap. Having said that I still would recommend I'm sure if we had said anything they would've fixed the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Feeling”
Reviews.Author: WeFlyHigh
Reviews.Content: Staff: very nice and friendly Rooms: It looks more like bedrooms then typical hotel rooms. Def. older than other places and not as modern (ie. Hiltons, Marriot). Nonetheless it was still a good stay because it was very cozy. Location: On the Boardwalk, at the very beginning. It is by the carnival. Great location. Pool: The pool was small but good enough. It only went up to five feet and there is a smaller area for children. It seemed as if it was easily accessible to outside people. It was clean and was sufficient for someone like me who just wanted to catch some sun and occasionally dip in the pool when it got too hot. Negatives: I don't recall any continental breakfast being offered, but I coffee was available. There is a small charge for ice (50cents I believe).

Reviews.Title: “Our go-to place in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: OCFanMaryland
Reviews.Content: We visit OC often,several times a year - and the Atlantic is always our first choice. Location is the absolute best in all of OC,and the rooms are always comfortable,and the a/c works great. We always stay on ground level,which are the accessible rooms,since otherwise you are up and down stairs all day/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stereoears
Reviews.Content: Right in the hub-bub of the Ocean City fun, this family owned hotel has a lot of pride. Its one of the original OC buildings and the family keeps its in tip-top shape. The pool is wonderful and clean. The newly opened snack & bar is a super addition. Go to the rooftop deck for a spectacular view of the 'goings on' at night. Since its in the heart of the boardwalk commerce and amusement, there is noise until the city ordinance kicks in a 11pm. We stay in one of the apartments. Everything very well maintain and immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location Great place on the Boards Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: jimloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. This is an older hotel so if you want 5 star than this is not for you. The place is very clean. The price is a little high for a room but you are also paying for a location. We will stay again. We did not even need the car to get a great meal. You can walk to most places. Parking is free. Hotel is on the boardwalk in the heart of ocean city. The Hotel has a great deck overlooking the boards. The deck has a great oceanfront view. Its a great historic beach hotel that has been taken care of well. It has a pool & there are places inside to relax,read a book etc. Now some reasons that it's not a 5 star hotel. They only have a service elevator. Guest can use this but the staff must work it. We used the steps except when we were unloading & loading the car. The rooms are not really ocean view or ocean front like you would think, but the outside deck has a great oceanfront view. The rooms are small but very clean. Some have better stuff than others. Our room had a great sink (places to sit your stuff) with an older TV. The room beside us had a basic sink & a flat screen. If you are going to the beach & want a good place to shower & sleep in the best location this is the place. If you are staying with 2 kids that are small & need a room run than this room may not work for you. My kids are 11&15 so it was fine for us for 3 days (2nights). If we went for a week we would want a larger room . Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel, great location for the amusements, parking but a little expensive given the room was quite small and breakfast was”
Reviews.Author: Khutc
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. I liked the old style lift. There was parking outside, although this was a public parking lot. Our car was scraped in the night by another car. The staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location for the family”
Reviews.Author: Jenny T
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel given some of the mixed bag reviews, but our stay turned out great! I read a review that had me worried about the parking, but it was fine, always plenty of parking. Of course, we went in mid-September, so that's off season, which probably helped. The location was great, very clean rooms. The old fashioned elevator was a little inconvenient, but was fine. The staff was very nice, very helpful. They overhead us talking about breakfast in the parking lot and someone offered up some ideas. The staff cleaning our room was very nice in asking if we needed more towels, etc. (we left them a nice tip). It was a little weird to pay for the whole stay up front, but not a problem. Yes, the sink was outside the bathroom which is atypical, but worked out just fine. The pool was one of the warmest I think I've ever been in, so that was a nice treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hospitality, and charm.”
Reviews.Author: broncostang
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here based on location, price, and tripadvisor reviews. We couldn't have been more happy. Our room was more recently updated with a flatscreen tv, micro, and fridge. It was very clean with a comfy king size bed. The staff there were very friendly. The pool wasn't very big, but it was clean and well maintained as was the rest of the hotel. There is an elevator if you have trouble with climbing stairs. The 2nd floor deck overlooking the boardwalk and ocean is great. We sat outside on some rocking chairs and ate our breakfast. The adjacent bar has a window at the pool so you can order drinks or food and the prices were suprisingly reasonable. The only minor quibbles we had were that the bathroom was pretty tiny and while the towels were clean, they were pretty cheap. Also, there were no hooks in the room which seemed odd considering it's the beach. We had to get creative in hanging our swimwear and beach towels to dry for the next day. All in all a great place and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: judy g
Reviews.Content: Room smaller than most hotels but very clean. Bed was comfortable and staff was very friendly. Had to go to front desk for new soap and shampoo but they provided it quickly and were very courteous. Parking lot was a little tight so if you have a large vehicle be careful. Not really the hotel's fault-they try to supply enough parking in limited space. For the price you can't beat the location or the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you can live with a few minor inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: OH-Proud
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel the week of August 14th. Overall we were quite pleased with the room. Stayed in Room 7 with two Queen beds and a micro/fridge. This room is in a great location. It is on the ground floor with the entrance being from the outside courtyard. There are only 2 rooms with access from the courtyard --Room 7 and Room 11. The outside shower to wash off sand is located in the courtyard and if you walk out of the room and turn to the right you walk directly into the hotel and then out to the parking lot (no stairs to climb). If you walk out of the room to the left you go down a small corridor and end up on Somerset Street and you are then literally steps to the boardwalk and beach. We had no problems with noise -- the air conditioner provides quite a lot of background noise-- but we never heard any noise from the boardwalk. Also, there did not seem to be a lot of foot traffic through the corridor. We were out of the room quite a bit, but back in by 10 or 11 each night and never noticed a lot of noise or foot traffic. The parking lot is large and we only moved the car 2 times and were always able to find a parking spot. You are able to walk to most locations and we chose to ride the Boardwalk Tram and Bus to see the further outskirts of Ocean City. The room was clean and we always had plenty of towels. I didn't think the water got very hot and the water pressure was low in the shower. The main issue I had with our room was that there were no hooks anywhere in the room to dry your towels. We had brought our own beach towels and our room was furnished with the 2 beds, dresser, micro/fridge and 1 chair. There are no hooks in the bathroom to hang towels on and the sink was located next to the bed so the bathroom has no countertop to set anything on . The bathroom consists of the toilet, bathtub/shower and one towel rack-- no counter space. I was at a loss as to where to hang up towels, suits, etc. Luckily we brought several suits so it worked out. There were a few hangers in the open closet area but we were using those to hang clothing on. I told the front desk clerk about possibly installing hooks in the future and she said that they had several people request them recently and also an over the door hook. Hopefully they will head these suggestions and install them. I also learned that each room is funished differently and that the front desk has a list of what furniture each room contains. I learned that Room 11 in the courtyard was identical to ours but also had a small table and chairs located in the room. If I would have known this, I would have requested room 11 as it was difficult with the only place to sit in our room being the beds or the one straight back chair. Also, Room 7 and 11 are slightly larger than some of the other rooms. Be sure to bring: hairdryer (not one in the room), iron (never saw one) They do not have coffeemakers in the room. Coffee is available in the lobby every morning. Overall, we had a nice stay and the location cannot be beat. The pool was a nice size for our kids and the depth was great. It wasn't overcrowded. The porch overlooking the Boardwalk is really nice and fun to watch the people as well as the Slingshot ride at Jolly Roger. I watched 2 beautiful sunrises on the deck. We would seriously consider staying here again, but would choose Room 11.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: auntsRfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd year in a row. We love the location of the hotel and the boardwalk. The front desk staff were very friendly as well as the housekeeping staff on our floor. Love the porch and rocking chairs to watch out over the boardwalk. Planning on staying here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible”
Reviews.Author: emster31
Reviews.Content: On the first morning we found splatters of blood on our sheets near the foot of the bed, and after inspecting ourselves, knew that it was not our blood. Not raising a stink about it like we should have, we put out the sign for our room to be cleaned and remade, and thought this would take care of it. We were wrong. The next morning (did not inspect the sheets that night as we should have) we saw the same spots of blood in the same spot on the sheets! I was disgusted and even though my husband did not want to say anything, I did. But that isn't the worst of it. The worst of it is when I told the manager when we were checking out, she seemed genuinely concerned and had the head of the cleaning staff go and check it out. That woman went upstairs to check it out, and came down and looked us in the eye and essentially blamed us for the blood and said we ruined her sheets. After being spoken to in such a rude and embarrassing way, I went to speak to the manager who sided with her, saying "if you have a problem with it, then you should just not come back". This was the worst experience of customer service i have ever had. Obviously if it was her fault that the sheets were bloody, but also failed to get changed with this obvious mistake, she clearly was looking to get out of this huge failure to DO HER JOB! But then to blame us for it and to treat us like the common criminal was ridiculous. If we had ruined her sheets, why would we TELL them about it?? I will never go back and here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the beach”
Reviews.Author: Fishtherapy
Reviews.Content: Atlantic hotel was not a five star hotel but it was perfect for the Ocean City. We stayed two nights. We paid $30 extra a night to have a refrigerator and microwave. We used the microwave to heat left overs and stored our water and wine in the frig. Atlantic is right on the boardwalk near Ripley's. It has a huge balcony to sip your wine on while people watching those on the boardwalk. The room is o.k. The air conditioner provided white noise so we slept solid and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is very old and we were suprised to see the toilet next to the bed instead of in the bathroom. The shower was roomy and had plenty of hot water. We had a lot of stairs to get to our room / bathroom, there is no bathroom in the lobby. However, they do have an elevator that staff can assist you with if you can not do stairs. The pool is small but big enough, 6" to 5' deep. Overall, very nice place to stay (if you don't mind the sink next to your bed), odd but we got over that quickly. Staff were very friendly and they had coffee ready at 6:00a. They also have bike and segway rental in the side alley. I don't believe they have a fittness center but who needs that, you can get all the excercise you want for free by walking the boardwalk or on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “just ok and we probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: JenFreshley
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, both good and bad, we decided that the sun-thurs deal was too good to pass up. The price is great and the location is awesome but we still won't stay here again. The check in time is 3:00 and when we got there is was 3:00. There was a lot of people in the lobby waiting for rooms and seemed very irritated. This gave me a clue what we were in for. People were coming to the desk saying they got the wrong rooms as they had doubles when they booked queens. The staff repeatedly stated that the beds were queens. We had to wait for 45 min till our room was available. The desk staff wasn't even apologetic in any way. Our room was laid out weird and so small with two "queens". These beds were the smallest queens I have ever seen. I think some of the rooms may be decent and we just got stuck with a bad one. The housekeeping staff would leave doors open as they cleaned them so we could look inside as we were walking past. Some of these rooms looked really good compared to ours. One actually had a large flat screen tv. The inner door to our room would shake like someone was trying the door whenever someone would walk by. This got very annoying when trying to sleep. My husband put socks in the door so stop the rattling. The housekeeping staff was very thorough and was polite when passing in hallways. The head of housekeeping was not polite and seemed abrupt with the staff in front of patrons of the hotel. Yes, the price is good and the location is unbeatable, so if you can put up with a cramped, noisy room with not great customer service, then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with an old fashioned feel”
Reviews.Author: HoneymooningDuo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Atlantic Hotel recently and were throughly surprised with the size of the hotel but the country feel of the room. It reminded us of a bed and breakfast but with all the attractions on the boardwalk just steps away. Room was clean and felt so cozy and warm and the location couldnt have been better. We enjoyed our stay so much that we have already decided that our next vacation to Ocean City, we will be staying at the Atlantic hotel. One thing to note, the size of some of the rooms are a bit small depending on how many people are in your party, and if you happen to have a room on the 1st or 2nd floor, be ready to go up some steep stairs cause there is no passenger elevator. But those very small issues in comparison with the comfort, friendly staff at the front desk and most importantly the location of the hotel can be overlooked. Quite simply, you will enjoy your stay at the Atlantic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we will always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: nannyp7
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Atlantic Hotel every year. It's clean and the staff are always helpful. When we need towels we just put the dirty ones in the hall. I read reviews and people complained that they couldn't get towels unless they went to the front desk, and the tv had no remote. When we check in we ask for the tv remote. They ask for a 10.00 deposit. Big deal. As long as u return it you get it back. Bring your own hairdryer. I recommend the Atlantic to everyone. Now my children take their children and stay at the Atlantic. We love it and will always stay here! Thank You to the staff for doing awonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Inn and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TXNative74
Reviews.Content: We loved the quaint, old-fashioned hotel feel. The location was perfect for being in the middle of boardwalk activity, yet the hotel had a secluded inn-type feel. The huge balcony full of rocking chairs overlooking the boardwalk was wonderful, and being able to walk right out onto the boardwalk was perfect. The rooms were spacious enough, and though the lavatory was in the corner, there was plenty of room and everything was immaculate. The bathroom and lavatory were sparkling white; it was so clean the caulk looked brand new. The noise was not a problem; the AC drowned out any hallway noise. The small pool was quiet and clean. I loved supporting a local hotel that deserved it. Far better than most chain hotels I've stayed in. As well, since the endless lines of hotels started a few blocks down, this stretch of beach was the least crowded. We will definitely return both as a couple and with the family. It's perfect for both.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: scottie27
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for about 30 years. It is within walking of the Bay and right on the Beach .Very good price and clean. It is quaint still the old decor. Over the years they added air conditioning, t.v's, and pool. I love the deck. I have been there for the 4th of July, fireworks right in front of the hotel. Also vollyball nets and summer concerts right in front. Large parking lot, and you don't have to move your car.Lots to do there! Even took my honeymoon here.

Reviews.Title: “It was grrrrrrreat plan on staying there JULY 2011!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: greatestmimi56
Reviews.Content: it is a very charming hotel . I read some of the negative reviews.If you want a castle and someone to wait on you then you need to go else where. We had a nice time here and the stafff was very polite. The location is great with amusement parks right there ,and very many different places to eat . i like that you can go right out on to boardwalk from the lobby. It is so cozy and homey i can't wait to go back this will be the fourth year we stayed there. It is very reasonable. We like the pool area also it is kept clean. It is not hard to find.You don'thave to move your car much you can use the bus to go eat or to play miniature golf or other attractions that are close by. There is bike rental right next door to the hotel. Clothing stores to shop at .I would tell my friends to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: SpydersGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Atlantic because we wanted a hotel on the boardwalk that was reasonably priced. Since the Atlantic got pretty good reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to give it a try. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It's right at the beginning of the boardwalk. The hotel has a WONDERFUL deck overlooking the boardwalk and, obviously, facing the beach and ocean. My husband and I enjoyed sitting on the deck to people watch in the evenings and we even watched the sunrise one morning. The hotel itself is very, very quaint. The Atlantic was one of the first, if not the first, hotel on the boardwalk. The hotel managers have maintained the hotel in such a way that it is easy to imagine what it was like in the days when it was first built -- but in a good way!! (Please be warned, if you are looking for a fancy, modern, luxury hotel, do not stay here. You will be disappointed!!) I have the pros and cons of this hotel listed below but I did want to commment on some of the comments others have made about this hotel. Some people have complained about having to use the stairs. Unless you have some physical limitation or health condition that prevents you from doing it, who really can complain about having to climb stairs. The hotel is only three stories, for Pete's sake! All the food that you eat on the boardwalk needs to be burned off somehow!! There is an elevator at this hotel but it is an old-fashioned one that requires the staff there to operate it. We only used it to take our luggage in and out of the hotel. Also, people have complained about not being able to find the hotel. We had no problems finding it when we entered, " 1 Wicomico Street, Ocean City, Maryland" into our GPS system. It took us right there. As for the sink in the room -- definitely weird, but not a deal breaker. Pros: Location, location, location!!!! Sundeck was awesome Hotel and our room were clean -- but I did find little bit of mildew on grout between a few of the shower tiles -- not a huge deal but I noticed it. Staff was friendly and helpful Quiet, family hotel Cons: A/C -- pretty noisy but didn't keep us awake at night. Wifi is not free. Rooms are on the small side and don't have a lot of seating other than the bed

Reviews.Title: “This review will thoroughly tell you what you're getting here”
Reviews.Author: ohcoasterfreak
Reviews.Content: First I will describe the hotel experience in total, then I will give some tips and pros and cons about the The Atlantic Hotel. We originally booked the Atlantic Hotel because of the rate and location, location, location! My family and my best friends family booked a 3 queen bed room to sleep 4 adults, 1 preteen and an infant. My best friend's family had to cancel on the trip, so we re-booked to a 1 queen bed room a month before with no problems. We arrived at the Atlantic on a Sunday evening around 9pm and had a lot of luggage due to traveling with an infant. Checked in and got a room on the 3rd floor deck level because it had rocking chairs that would be useful in putting our baby to sleep. Not the best idea. This hotel has an elevator that is old, and only used for luggage and housekeeping. They did have someone help me get all of my luggage to the room even at 10pm. The room was small but clean with a bed and breakfast type of feel. With a portable crib and luggage it was tight. The bathrooms were very clean, but be prepared: in alot of the rooms the sink is in the ROOM, not in the bathroom and there is very little counter space except for the drawer cabinet top. It was a bit awkward but workable. The space issue was not. I went to the front desk and asked for a room that had more space such as a 2 queen bed room. They checked and said they had none for that night but to check in the morning, as some people were checking out the next day. I did so and they accommodated me with a 1st floor 2 queen bed room in the courtyard in the middle of the hotel. This was perfect! We got room 11, which I recommend for anyone with children at stroller age. It had more space with caddy-corner beds and a 2 chair table with the sink IN the bathroom. And you can walk right out of your door with the stroller to the street that leads to the beach. There are three down falls with this room. Less security, everyone coming back from the beach comes back by this room and if it rains like it did on us, you are outside in it trying to get to your room. Another plus to the courtyard is the wash station for the beach with a hose and shower are right outside your room to wash you and all of your things. This room was very clean but had a slightly musty smell near the front door. Housekeeping did a good enough job, my only complaint here was they did not vacuum every day. There is no free ice machine, so if you want ice it is .50 from the machine or 1.50 for a bag of ice from the front desk. We swam in the pool a few times, it is nice but small. It has a shallow 1/2ft area for small children, and goes as deep as 5ft. We were able to get lunch and dinner easily steps from our room on the boardwalk, but breakfast proved more difficult. The hotel itself is nice and kept clean, but is not modern at all, do not expect Holiday inn, again expect bed and breakfast that is literally steps from the main area of the boardwalk. Parking can be bad at night because after 9pm everyone comes in to sleep and the lot is not large. They only allow one car per room and that is a good thing. One thing to be aware of, the doors are regular doors, with a key you have to use to lock the door on your way out, no hotel key cards here! Lastly, this hotel is right in the middle of the main part of the Ocean City boardwalk but don't be afraid of noise at night, it really is very quiet! Tips: Get a parking spot before 9pm, it fills fast. Request a ground floor room, especially if you have infants or kids. Get a room with a fridge and microwave, it will save on the ice buying and keep your drinks cold. Bring your own pillow if possible. Try Thrashers fries! Use the tram to get to far parts of the boardwalk. Cons: No on site laundry. Sinks in room not in the bathroom in some units. Rooms are on the small side. Little counter space. Small parking lot. No free ice machine. Elevator is for service only, not passenger traffic. Pillows aren't great, bring your own if you can. Food on boardwalk is expensive. (Not the fault of hotel, just good to know.) Not much security, anyone can walk anywhere in the hotel or pool area with no way to know if they should be there. Pros: Location, location, and location! Great rates, best in the area on the boardwalk! Clean rooms and decent beds. Can open windows all the way for fresh air. Decent air conditioning units. Free parking for one car. Very accommodating and helpful staff. Steps from the busiest part of the boardwalk and fishing pier. Steps from the beach. Steps from any food you may want, except for few breakfast choices. Quiet even though it's so close to the boardwalk. Nice deck with rocking chairs over the boardwalk to relax and people watch. Nice but small pool area. Steps from the tram and bus lines.(We rode the boardwalk tram but not the buses.) Very close to two amusement areas. Close to Thrashers fries, they are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location.....and clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: TABWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My sister, her 2 teenage daughters and I stayed here for 4 nights. We absolutely loved the location on the boardwalk ...and the deck! We had a room with 2 queen beds, microwave, and refrigerator. We had decided that all we cared about was to have a CLEAN room since we wouldn't be in the room very much. We were very happy that the room was clean (and had everything that we needed), the staff was nice, the deck was wonderful to sit on at night, and we were right on the boardwalk and beach. The hotel overall was quiet, and the sleeping was great. It is kind of a pain that you have to turn in your used towels to get new towels, but I understand that people probably take their towels outside and don't bring them back. We had no problems with this hotel.....and I hope to stay there again some day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: brc2222
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay. Room was spacious enough, clean, right on the boards near everything, and inexpensive. What more could you want. The pool area was small but never crowded. The porch overlooking the boardwalk was great and again never crowded. The only drawback was my room was on the top floor and we had to climb the stairs quite a bit. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: missy47543
Reviews.Content: When we decided as a family to take a trip to O.C. I first had the Comfort Suites booked,which is not located on the boardwalk for a grand total of $1200.00 for a four night stay. I am very paticular and was going to give up location for a nicer hotel but was not willing to spend the high prices the Holiday inn, Hilton, etc. were offering. But then I went to trip advisor and they rated this hotel pretty high and i decided to give it a try and cancelled my reservations at the comfort suites but still very skeptical. The 4 night stay at the Atlantic was a grand total of $525.00. If you check in on a sunday the 4th night was free. I was nervous the whole way down from upstate N.Y. To my suprise to was very neat and clean. Yes the rooms were small and no balcony but i did expect that. I knew before booking it there was no balcony but the sundeck was great! The outside of the hotel was neat and clean. The pool was small but the water was warm and clean. They had comfortable lounge chairs and a outside bar which offered $5 pina colidas and slushies for the kids. Like others have stated this is not the Marriott which i have stayed in. You just have to go there and not expect all the extras. I even brought my flash light and inspected for bed bugs and there was NOTHING. I pulled the mattress and sheets up and looked several times. Everything was clean. Sure I could find alot to say negative like small rooms, no balcony, low water pressure but for $500 for a 4 night stay on the ocean i am not complainig. Every morning in the lobby my husband and i would get a cup of coffee and sit on the sundeck at the end of the hall, which was never crowded. To get into your room they still have the old lock and key. which was a little hassle. I would recommend hanging your clothes on a hanger and putting them in the closet due to the lack of space in the room for suitcases. because of the money we saved staying there,we were able to spend more money on seafood dinners, jetskis,parasailing etc. After walking the boardwalk at night and seeing what else there was to offer I made a wise choice by staying at the Atlantic Hotel. I guess to sum it up you felt like you were staying in a victorian style house, not a hotel. For the money I saved I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fair price”
Reviews.Author: CareBearCarrie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 5 day trip from Ocean City. This was our first time staying at this hotel. We picked this hotel because of the location. We wanted to be on the boardwalk (near the end) and not spend a fortune. This is one of the original hotels (over 100 years old). The hotel is very old and full of character. It's a really neat place but it does have a few 'quirks'. If you don't know what to expect you might be in for a surprise. The rooms and bathrooms are small. A "typical" modern hotel room would be much larger than these rooms. The hotel has one elevator but it is quite old and I believe you need to have the front desk turn it on for you. We never used it. The hotel is 4 floors. The first is ground/street level. You go up one flight to the lobby. From there you have two more stories. We were on the top floor and didn't mind the stairs. If you have small children I would suggest requesting ground level. (They also list they have handicap accessible rooms. I believe these are the ground/street level.) The staff was very kind and helpful. We arrived early (11:30 ish). Although check in is not until 3 pm the staff gave us our packing permit early and pushed our room to the top of the list to be prepared. Our room was ready by 12:30 pm. The room was small but clean and comfortable. We had the 1 queen bed (no fridge or microwave). There was the bed, a dresser with a tv, small night stand, small desk and chair and pedestal sink. Yes, we did have the sink in the bedroom. You had to walk out of the bathroom and around the bed to get to the sink. One of the quirks of this place. It never bothered us. Since it was just the two of us we opted for the 1 bedroom room. Walking down the halls we were able to peak into some other rooms. The 2 bedroom rooms looked like they were a nice size. I even saw one with a portable crib setup and it looked like there was still enough room to walk around comfortably. The hotel does have a small pool. It was kept very clean and was a wonderful spot to cool off away from the boardwalk and beach crowds. Often there were only one or two families down there. It never seemed to be overly crowded. The roof-top deck/patio has several rocking chairs. It was a nice place to sit at night (too hot during the day). We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Kmywalker3
Reviews.Content: The rooms run a little on the small side - depending on which one you get. Since this is an older hotel, none of the rooms are the same size. BUT - if you're looking for CLEAN and good value/ location, you can't ask for more. My husband and I have made this our place to stay for the last 2 years and we love it! If you're looking for modern, and fancy, this probably isn't for you - but if you're looking for a nice no frills beach getaway, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: erinmcd14
Reviews.Content: If I were to describe this hotel in one word, it would be "fine." Honestly, with the amount of money I paid, I wasn't expecting much. But my stay was perfectly fine. The location is fabulous. You are right across from the amusement park, above a Candy Kitchen, and very close to many good seafood restaurants. You are guaranteed a free parking space all weekend, and there is an outdoor pool, though I never used it. The shared balcony is also very nice. There are rocking chairs and you have a great view of the ocean and the ferris wheel at night. The room was small, but clean. The mattress was very comfy with no signs of bedbugs. The TV is old but functioning with cable. There is a window AC unit that works just fine. The sink is in the room, which is really awkard, and there is almost no space to hang towels or wet bathing suits. The bathroom is small with a toilet and shower, but clean. The big downside is that the walls are very thin, so at night we had no problem falling asleep, but by 8am the hotel was very loud. It was pretty hard to sleep late. Third, there is no elevator. Since I was only staying 2 nights, this was not a problem. But if you have a family and a lot of luggage, this would be difficult. So, all in all, this hotel was worth what I paid. If you are looking for a cheap, clean room that you probably won't spend very much time in, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: polkadotfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value especially given the location right in the middle of the boardwalk action. It was clean and the people were friendly. The roof top deck was nice for people watching. However, the hotel didn't really work for our family. I have two small children. The rooms are very, very small and there was no room for them to play and it was frustrating bumping into each other. It would be nice if they had balconies for each room, that way mom and dad can sit outside and enjoy the view while the kids napped or slept. The absolute worst part of the hotel was that there was no elevator (there is an old one that has to be operated by hotel staff which is rarely available). It was terrible lugging in all of the luggage and baby necessaties. We had to take the stroller in and out of the car after each use because it was such a pain to take it upstairs plus we didn't have space in the room for it any way. I think it would be a great hotel for a couple or a family with older children but it is rough with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Victorian Inn on the Ocean City Boardwalk, I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: robatpace
Reviews.Content: I want to get this out of the way first - this is not a Hilton, Marriot, or Sheraton ... if you are looking for that type of Hotel, then this place is not for you. If you are looking for a clean, well kept property with clean sheets, clean carpets, spotless bed and bath, for a good value - in a prime location - then keep reading... I stayed at the Atlantic Hotel for two nights just after the Fourth of July weekend. I found this hotel via tripadvisor and was confident that the pictures people sent were fair and accurate. I paid ~ $125/night. The Hotel is located a few blocks from the end of Ocean City, right across from the gaming/ride pier. The Hotel is within a few blocks of numerous restaurants, bars, and shops. The Hotel appears to be an authentic Victorian Inn with renovations. My room was clean and tidy. The room had AC, TV, bathroom and closet space. The room did not have a hair dryer, couch, desk, or refrigerator/microwave (rooms are available with this option for $ -- we brought a well stocked cooler of beverages/food and ice - we were fine without the fridge) - which was fine for us, as we were aware of this prior to booking. The management and support staff were friendly. The pool area was nice, although small. They had a small cabana with cold drinks. The sun deck was a great place to hang out on at night with a cold drink. The sounds of the ocean and sights were relaxing. There were rocking chairs to sit on. This place is a great place to stay with the idea that this is not a resort, but a place to relax in the evening and sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Yiiiikes!”
Reviews.Author: greenerpaztures
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at this place. There were four of us in a room, and we each paid $120 for a Friday and Saturday night. I guess this is cheap for Ocean City during peak beach hours; however, I would have happily paid several hundred more to stay somewhere decent. While the hotel is in a prime location located on the boardwalk and across from the Jolly Roger amusement park on the boardwalk, the hotel is a total dump. Upon entering the room, I was immediately worried that the place would be infested with bedbugs and/or cockroaches. The mattresses were as thin as a crib mattress and the sheets and pillows were stained. The towels were the size of a hand towel and only one per person. If you wanted additional towels, you have to bring your soiled towels back to the front desk and they'll give you more. The sink is located in the room and the shower and toilet are enclosed in what feels like a tiny half bath. Be prepared to dry and change in the room, not the bathroom. The management was rude and they don't allow you to use the elevator. So be prepared to lug your heavy suitcases up a couple flights of stairs. I would never stay at this place again nor would I recommend it to any friends. This is the perfect place for newly graduated high school students on senior week, but not for a group of late twenty-something women.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: TennisRF
Reviews.Content: I've been to Ocean City several times, but this was the first time I tried this hotel due to the mostly positive reviews on tripadvisor (and better pricing than some other hotels). I don't get why so many people gave it a perfect 5, because it definitely wasn't perfect. It wasn't bad either though. First off, it was hard to find because they don't provide an exact address -- you need to turn down Wicomoco St and then turn left on S Baltimore Ave and the parking lot is right next to Wild Bill's, which you should be able to spot easily. Parking seemed ok for us, we only left once a day for dinner and came back pretty early. Now about the hotel room -- the bathroom is SO small, you can't just walk in and close the door, you have to maneuver around to close the door (and I am a small person!). It's so small, they had to stick the sink outside of the bathroom (and awkwardly, there was no place to hang a towel by the sink). The water temp in the shower kept fluctuating a lot, hot then cold...hadn't experienced that in a regular hotel before. The worst part was that we had a hard time sleeping the first night because you could hear people talking in the hallway as loud as if they were in your room. We discovered the next day that you can close a vent on the door (don't ask why there would even be a vent on the door) and turn on the AC (was not automatically turned on) which helped drown out some of the outside noise, so luckily we were able to sleep the second night. On the positive side, the room seemed pretty clean, which is more than I can say for the hotel I stayed in last year. The tv is small and old. No hair blow dryer. They didn't provide new shampoo/conditioner if you used any. Oh and another weird thing, the agreement that you sign when you check-in says that if you want new towels you have to bring your dirty ones to the front desk...though it seemed like the cleaning people changed our towels for us anyway. Next time I go to Ocean City, I'm going to check out other hotels before considering booking this one again. If I had to, I would stay here again over other hotels considering the price & and great location, but there are probably some better options available. Pros: -Awesome location, right by the amusement park -Priced well compared to other hotels in the area -Pretty clean -Firm bed Cons: -Noisy -No balcony for room (can't see much out window) -No free internet -Tiny bathroom

Reviews.Title: “The best Value for your Dollar in Ocean City MD.”
Reviews.Author: Cwcarpenter3
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, there is no other Hotel in Ocean City that you can beat for the value! This is by no means your modern hotel or a chain hotel. It has more of a bed and breakfast feeling to the hotel. So if you can adjust to that style, this hotel is for you! The rooms are very clean. The location of the hotel is great. It is located right off the boardwalk in downtown Ocean City where you are in walking distance of almost every major attraction. The rooms are a old time bed and breakfast style with basic tv. Not a big deal if you are planning on spending more time outside you room on vacation than inside your room. Service is very nice and they try their best to compliment any requests you may have. Finally for all the value...you cannot beat the price. Other similar hotel are more than double the price!!

Reviews.Title: “sucks”
Reviews.Author: heythere1050
Reviews.Content: The management at the hotel was very rude. Upon arrival we were forced to pay a securtiy deposit when we were told there was none. I stayed in the hotel for one week and the cleaning staff entered our room several times without permission. The door was left unlocked each time. The cleaning staff also refused to clean the room because there was a small box of crackers that was accidentally spilled on the floor. They cleaned the room once the entire week. The walls are paper thin, and you are constantly being disturbed in the middle of the night by people walking and talking in the halls. You have absolutely no privacy, and nobody besides the paying attendants are allowed to enter the room at all times. This was the worst experience I have ever had involving a hotel. I would strongly not recommend anyone who wants to have a decent time at the beach to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “1 July 2010 - Excellent stay - again.”
Reviews.Author: Retirement2010
Reviews.Content: Just got back today. Gotta love this hotel. Third time I've stayed there. Not fancy (based on modern or 'chain' hotel/motels), but very clean and right at the beginning (boardwalk) of everything OC has to offer. Probably more importantly, can't beat the price. Price - about half of the 'chain' hotels. I made 'quick' reservations this past Friday, and the price was half of what the other 'chain' hotels wanted for the same size room. Most of the chain hotels offered a deck for each room, but for $200 less, I'll take the shared deck and pocket the difference. Shared 'deck'..(as opposed to a private ocean view balcony), but I think there weren't more than 6 people on the deck any time I went out. Which is to say, you won't/don't necessarily have a "ocean view" room with a private balcony (although it looks like they have four rooms with a 'view' from the deck side end-of-unit rooms). Personally, I'm not sure I'd like any of those rooms. I believe they are a little smaller than the one we had this time around. And, since these four rooms adjoin the 'deck', you 'may' possibly have an issue with possible rowdy folks who 'might' want to party on the deck during the evening hours. Haven't seen that myself though, so it wouldn't be a concern for me. Deck "officially" closes at 12 A.M.) Location - right on the boardwalk at Wicomico St. (Across from Ripley's) Great view of ocean from two level deck. Clean. No strange smells (non-smoking). Housekeeping staff is very good. Our room appears to have been recently painted. Parking next to hotel. Haven't had a problem with parking spaces yet. Took two vehicles this time around. This time, our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the pool. Very quiet. Micro/refrig/Air. Not a big pool, but I don't think I saw more than half a dozen people in it at any given time. So you won't be cramped for swimming space. Questions: bishop01us@yahoo.com I did take some photos, but will wait to see if anyone wants them. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: natlite
Reviews.Content: Pulling into the parking lot I couldn't believe all the parking spaces that are located right in front of the main entrance, overlooking a small porch. As you enter the lobby it is huge and beautifully decorated and loaded with comfortable seating. There is a door that takes you directly onto the heart of the boardwalk next to "Ripley's Believe it or Not." The hotel has different types of rooms and apts. My sister and I had just a room without a frig or microwave. The room was a good size with a big dresser, chair, side dresser w/drawers,tv, a good sze closet that you can walk in. A C that worked great. The sink was located in the room. The bathroom is small with the toliet and shower. The shower was a long as a bath tub. Love it. At the end of the hallway was a door that led out onto a huge deck with rocking chairs overlooking the boardwalk. Outside down stairs there is a gated headed pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stylistmjn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Atlantic for over 30yrs. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. In the middle of everything, staff is wonderful, hotel very clean. Love Charley,Teresa,Jodi,Mrs Smith,Bill and Mr and Mrs Purnell. They have made us feel like part of their family over the years.Mollie and Mike

Reviews.Title: “Um, not an upper class hotel”
Reviews.Author: shopkins1994
Reviews.Content: If you are used to paying $50 for a hotel stay when you travel then this will be the best hotel you ever stayed at. If you are used to staying at Marriott then keep looking. The room had no hair dryer, the shampoo bottle had been refilled so many times the label wore off and you didn’t know what it was, there were two soap boxes, one didn't have any soap in it. The room was small and the bed was about 10 years old. The covers were old as well. They are very hard to find. They don't have an address. Travel down South Philadelphia St. Turn left onto Wicomico St. Make next left and immediately pull into parking lot on right. Don't think, don't look, just park. You'll notice their small sign that blends into the hotel once you park. Only expect to use the elevator for when you check in. They have to bring you up and down and it's a waste of time to grab someone. Our bathroom did not have a sink. The sink was in the bedroom. Literally, there was a sink with no counter in the bedroom. That's a new one for me. The TV was old and had no remote control. Expect to be woken up at all hours because the class of people that stays there. Imagine drunk bums yelling and screaming while they walk to their room. Great locaton on the boardwalk. Internet access is $4.99 an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Trip Was So Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: poorpeenie
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Atlantic was just as nice as the first time. The family owned hotel is so accomamodating and welcoming. The staff is great and very helpful. The hotel is kept very clean and is so charming. We will be back next year! The Mast Family.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Cities Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: gbdetroit
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by chance surfing the internet looking for reasonble beachfront place to stay in OC. This hotel is family owned and operated and the owners pride is evident by the cleanliness of the hotel property. This hotel built in the early 20's is by far better kept than most newer properties that I have stayed in. My teenagers loved the old time elevator and the excellent location right on the famous boardwalk and beach. Being a seasoned traveler I'll give up bells and whistles any day to get charm, history and clean comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “More bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: sweetleese
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at the Atlantic Hotel in Ocean City, Maryland and loved it. The staff was very nice and accomidating. The Hotel itself was very clean and convienent to everything that the boardwalk had to offer. The inside of the hotel reminded me of one of those little hotels in the French Quarter in New Orleans. I would definately stay there again. I don't think there is another hotel on the boardwalk where you get so much for so little. I was reading a review about parking at the Atlantic hotel. We had no problem. We moved our vehicle several times during our stay and never had a problem getting a parking spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsg5698
Reviews.Content: Pictures speak a thousand words. This hotel was a great find thanks to a Trip Adviser review. The hotel is located on the boardwalk behind a row of stores including MR DUCKS which makes it a little difficult to see, unless you are looking for it. The location is great, nice pool, clean rooms and VERY reasonable nightly rate. The oceanfront/boardwalk porch with rocking chairs is the roof of the stores as you can see from the pictures. Great for a weekend stay!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: brendared61
Reviews.Content: Seventh stay,,nice, warm and clean pool,,parking at the door,,nice staff especially the cleaning crew,,they take time and great care to "de-beach" your room. Make sure to request a room w/ micro-fridge if you want one,,if you need a larger room,,ask for 7 or 11 in the courtyard. My Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Parking”
Reviews.Author: Woody2766
Reviews.Content: The Parking there is lousy,They are greedy and try to get as many cars in that lot as possible.When I pay for a room i expect a Parking Spot.I dont like the ideal of them cramming all these other cars in the lot that doesnt even Have A room there ,just to make a buck.then you got to worry if your cars going to get messed up. My friend came to visit us for the night and they charged himand his girlfriend $50.i went out to my car to get something no more then 3 minutes after they got there and the same guy was charging other people $20 for the exact same thing my friends got charged $50 for. WHATS WITH THAT
